meanings.sent1: We will inaugurate the new library next week.
meanings.sent2: The mayor will inaugurate the city's first recycling program.
meanings.sent3: Let's inaugurate a weekly movie night at our house!
meanings.sent4: The sunrise seemed to inaugurate a day full of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's smile inaugurated a sense of warmth and welcome in the classroom.

meanings.definition: Swear in or formally introduce (someone) into office
meanings.sent1: The President will inaugurate the new governor tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The judge will inaugurate the jury before the trial begins.
meanings.sent3: I will inaugurate my cat as the official ruler of the house!
meanings.sent4: The ringing of the bell will inaugurate the start of the school year.
meanings.sent5: The principal's speech inaugurated a sense of pride in the students.
